sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Welcome to Unit 102 of our English learning journey. In this unit, we'll explore the use of 'so' and 'such' to express intensity, degree, and cause.

sections.title: Definition
sections.content: Understanding the nuances between these two words is crucial for precise communication. Let's delve into the key concepts.

sections.title: So
points: Understand how 'so' is used to emphasize degree or intensity

sections.title: Such
points: Explore the use of 'such' to emphasize degree or quality.

sections.title: Examples
sections.content: Let's examine examples to illustrate the application of 'so' and 'such'
points: The girl whose father is a doctor wants to become a nurse
The house where I grew up is now a museum
The teacher, whom the students admire, is retiring this year

sections.title: Usage and Content
sections.content: Understand the appropriate contexts for using 'so' and 'such' and how they contribute to the overall meaning of a sentence

sections.title: Recap and Summary:
sections.content: In summary, understanding how to use 'so' and 'such' allows you to express intensity, degree, and result with precision.

sections.title: Additional Resources:
sections.content: For additional practice and reinforcement, consider exploring examples in language learning books and online exercises.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.content: Thank you for joining today's lesson on 'So and Such.' Practice using these words confidently in various situations, and feel free to reach out if you have any questions. Happy learning!
